page.title: 17ANIMAL HUSBANDRY:ACTON/L'HAM
page.content: Primary area is devoted to production of cereal crops coupled with an area of intensive animal rearing. This consists of Friesian steers numbering between 500 and 600. The animals are bought in at about 12 weeks and sold at 11 months. The main cattle market is at Bury St. Edmunds. Breeding herds of pigs are also reared, the weaners sold at 12 weeks in Bury Market. The steers are fed on a diet of compound cereals and housed in purpose built units geared for the production of quality beef. The pigs are fed on a compound ration and housed in the same fashion. EEC Rules & Regulations have curtailed to some extent the sale of the beef and pork, as has the change in eating habits of the population who buy less meat and more wholefoods.
